verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all that were carried away captive of Jerusalem and Judah, which were carried away captive unto Babylon.
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD after Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guard, released him at Ramah. Jeremiah had been found bound in chains among all the captives from Jerusalem and Judah who were being taken away to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah, and said unto him, The LORD thy God hath pronounced this evil upon this place.
verses.ct: The commander of the guard pulled Jeremiah aside and told him, "The LORD your God declared that this disaster would come on this place.

verses.kjv: Now the LORD hath brought it, and done according as he hath said: because ye have sinned against the LORD, and have not obeyed his voice, therefore this thing is come upon you.
verses.ct: Now the LORD has carried it out and done exactly what he said he would, because you people sinned against the LORD and refused to listen to him. That is why all of this has happened to you.

verses.kjv: And now, behold, I loose thee this day from the chains which were upon thine hand. If it seem good unto thee to come with me into Babylon, come; and I will look well unto thee: but if it seem ill unto thee to come with me into Babylon, forbear: behold, all the land is before thee: whither it seemeth good and convenient for thee to go, thither go.
verses.ct: But today I'm removing the chains from your hands. If you'd like to come with me to Babylon, come along, and I'll take good care of you. But if you'd rather not come with me to Babylon, then don't. Look — the whole land is open to you. Go wherever you think is best."

verses.kjv: Now while he was not yet gone back, he said, Go back also to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon hath made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people: or go wheresoever it seemeth convenient unto thee to go. So the captain of the guard gave him victuals and a reward, and let him go.
verses.ct: Before Jeremiah could turn to leave, Nebuzaradan added, "Go back to Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, the man the king of Babylon has appointed as governor over the towns of Judah. Live with him among the people — or go wherever you think is best." Then the commander of the guard gave him food and a gift and sent him on his way.

verses.kjv: Then went Jeremiah unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and dwelt with him among the people that were left in the land.
verses.ct: So Jeremiah went to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah and lived with him among the people who remained in the land.

verses.kjv: Now when all the captains of the forces which were in the fields, even they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed unto him men, and women, and children, and of the poor of the land, of them that were not carried away captive to Babylon;
verses.ct: When all the military commanders still out in the countryside, along with their troops, heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam as governor over the land and had put him in charge of the men, women, and children — the poorest people of the land who had not been deported to Babylon —

verses.kjv: Then they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.
verses.ct: they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah. These included Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan and Jonathan sons of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah son of a Maachathite, along with all their troops.

verses.kjv: And Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan sware unto them and to their men, saying, Fear not to serve the Chaldeans: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it shall be well with you.
verses.ct: Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, made an oath to them and their men, saying, "Don't be afraid to serve the Babylonians. Settle down in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and things will go well for you.

verses.kjv: As for me, behold, I will dwell at Mizpah, to serve the Chaldeans, which will come unto us: but ye, gather ye wine, and summer fruits, and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that ye have taken.
verses.ct: As for me, I'll stay here at Mizpah to represent you before the Babylonian officials who come to us. But you — go harvest the wine, summer fruit, and olive oil. Store them in your jars and settle in the towns you've occupied."

verses.kjv: Likewise when all the Jews that were in Moab, and among the Ammonites, and in Edom, and that were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan;
verses.ct: In the same way, all the Jewish people who had fled to Moab, Ammon, Edom, and every other country heard that the king of Babylon had allowed a remnant to stay in Judah and had appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, as their governor.

verses.kjv: Even all the Jews returned out of all places whither they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, unto Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruits very much.
verses.ct: So all these Jewish refugees returned from every place they had scattered to. They came back to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah, and harvested an enormous amount of wine and summer fruit.

verses.kjv: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were in the fields, came to Gedaliah to Mizpah,
verses.ct: Then Johanan son of Kareah and all the military commanders who had been out in the countryside came to Gedaliah at Mizpah.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Dost thou certainly know that Baalis the king of the Ammonites hath sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to slay thee? But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam believed them not.
verses.ct: They said to him, "Are you aware that Baalis, the king of the Ammonites, has sent Ishmael son of Nethaniah to kill you?" But Gedaliah son of Ahikam didn't believe them.

verses.kjv: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spake to Gedaliah in Mizpah secretly, saying, Let me go, I pray thee, and I will slay Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no man shall know it: wherefore should he slay thee, that all the Jews which are gathered unto thee should be scattered, and the remnant in Judah perish?
verses.ct: Johanan son of Kareah spoke privately to Gedaliah at Mizpah, saying, "Please let me go and kill Ishmael son of Nethaniah. No one will ever find out. Why should he be allowed to kill you? All the Jewish people who have gathered around you would be scattered, and the remnant of Judah would be destroyed."

verses.kjv: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said unto Johanan the son of Kareah, Thou shalt not do this thing: for thou speakest falsely of Ishmael.
verses.ct: But Gedaliah son of Ahikam told Johanan son of Kareah, "You must not do this! What you're saying about Ishmael is a lie."
